intro: Gentiana stellulata var. stellulata, commonly known as the star gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Its flowers are tubular with five lobes, and they attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gentiana stellulata var. stellulata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
